word.literal: to not know what to do

sentence.idiomatic: In the last while he has always cut class; his mother doesn't know what to do with him.
Don't be too bothered by these kinds of minor matters--there are a lot of important things that are waiting on you to get done.
Getting married is really a troublesome affair; you have to prepare so many things.
Be rational--kicking up a fuss will not solve the problem.
He sometimes doesn't do things very rationally. He gets excited easily.
I never thought he would also lose all reason and be so impolite.
If you think it's no problem, sign your name on the divorce agreement.
Please carefully read through this user agreement.
We are handling things according to the agreement--what's wrong with that?
He was sentenced to a term of imprisonment of two years.
Although the court awarded custody of the child to the father, you can regularly visit the child.
If you think that the court's sentence is too severe, you can appeal.
Children are always the apple of their parents' eye.
Although your decision has hurt your mother, you are still her treasured flesh and blood.
You are your grandmother's favorite--when you go against her like this, she is very hurt.
We will absolutely not concede to irrational demands.
These two companies have different opinions on the price issue. Neither is willing to compromise.
Only if one of the parties involved is willing to compromise will we be able to carry on.
You can adjust your rest time according to the work requirements.
Next week we will be carrying out a restructuring of personnel. Please prepare yourselves, everyone.
A suitable restructuring of the production plan is utterly necessary built atop market demand.
Today she is going to the hospital to visit a friend who is hospitalized.
I'm sorry, visiting hours are over, we have to take the people away.
Although we are divorced, I still have the right to visit my child.
The two heads of state settled on holding a summit at a suitable time.
This problem is very perplexing. We still need to settle it through a step-by-step discussion.
The two parties carried out settlement discussions. Finally, the merger was completed at a suitable price.
She has a serious tendency towards suicide. She needs to see a clinical psychologist.
Children at this phase will have some of these tendencies. You must pay special attention.
His campaign platform is very realistic. The population is inclined to give him their vote.
(Sigh) Lately things have not been going well.
Is it your divorce?

That's right. I'm really at a loss. I only have myself to blame for being muddleheaded by love. I hadn't thought anything over clearly and just went and got married. When you are dating you definitely need to be rational.
Don't worry. Oh, did you get a consensual divorce, or was it a contested divorce?

It was contested. The property acquired during the marriage was split half and half. The proceeds from the sale of our house were also divided equally. Actually, I put in the majority of the money for the house. But, never mind. I don't have the energy to fight anymore.
So, what about your child? Who got him?

This was the biggest headache. He is still little. Before the divorce we were always arguing; he has already been affected a lot. Not to mention the divorce. Both of us of course want our child--after all he's our own flesh and blood. Neither of us were willing to compromise, so as a consequence our divorce dragged out a long time.
So, how did the court rule in the end?

Custody was given to her. Every month I pay child support, and will do so until our child is an adult. The amount is set according to his age, and adjusted according to his life circumstances. Actually, I am working so hard to earn money precisely because I want to give my child a comfortable life, and get a better education.
What about visitation rights?
We set this ourselves. When I miss our child, or he misses me, we can see each other.
Well, that's good. You love him so much--if you could only see him once a week, you would miss him so much. Oh, are Chinese courts more inclined to award the child to the mother?

That depends on the specific circumstances. Take me for example--although I conform to the emotional and financial requirements, because I am busy at work, I have no way to look after him. So in the end, the court awarded custody to his mother.
That's good too. As long as your son knows you love him it's all right.
I hope so.
